definition: to hit the big time
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Hong
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
purple/violet

sentences.english: Where the Spice Girls really, really came into their own was in marketing and merchandising.
sentences.chinese: 辣妹们真正大红大紫是在市场销售上。

sentences.english: Question:why most local cartoon can't be popular ?
sentences.chinese: 为什么本土动漫不能大红大紫？

sentences.english: Several years later, she gets very popular as expected.
sentences.chinese: 若干年后果然大红大紫。

sentences.english: In other words, my toenails weren't turning all purple and falling off because of this.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，我的脚指头没有因此变得“大红大紫”。

sentences.english: The low earnings here is probably due to the fact that so few in this field hit it big.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，在这个领域极少数人才能大红大紫。

sentences.english: He who was from or ed star dreams seem increasingly far.
sentences.chinese: 他离阿谁大红大紫的明星梦似乎越来越远。

sentences.english: She has become one of the most popular singers in the country.
sentences.chinese: 她已是国内大红大紫的歌星了。

sentences.english: But BY did not get progress past being a warm-up band and soon broke up.
sentences.chinese: 但BY乐队并未变得大红大紫，继而很快就解散了。

sentences.english: Think from was Laura fan can be bright red off himself.
sentences.chinese: 认为从此可大红大紫的罗拉迷掉了本人。

definition: to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
to make one's first public performance (of an entertainer etc)/to start one's career
to make one's name/to become famous
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
lit. it takes a long time to make a big pot (idiom); fig. a great talent matures slowly/in the fullness of time a major figure will develop into a pillar of the state/Rome wasn't built in a day
tremendously popular for a while
to win success and recognition (idiom)
show business
movie contract
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
prosperous
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
star/celebrity
